data.text:
List of Famous Egyptian Coptic churches

Egypt is home to a rich and different strict legacy, and the country's Coptic Christian people group has a long and captivating history that you will discover if you decide to take Egypt tours. If you're keen on investigating this part of Egypt's way of life and history, you'll need to visit some of the country's most well-known Coptic temples included in our Egypt travel packages. In this blog, we'll probably investigate Egypt's most striking Coptic houses of worship and what makes them unique and considered a must-see during Egypt day tours.

Churches in Egypt

1- The Hanging Church (El Muallaqa)

The Hanging Church, or El Muallaqa, is one of the most well-known Coptic temples included in our Cairo day tours. This old church is suspended over a door in the Babylon Post in Old Cairo, and its area gives it an exceptional and notable appearance. You will be amazed by its history and the blessings you will get during your Egypt Luxury tours. The congregation traces back to the seventh century and is known for its wonderful wood carvings, dazzling finished glass windows, and rich history. You can use your time in Cairo and take the Cairo City tour All inclusive you will enjoy visiting the Egyptian museum and Citadel of Qaitbay.

2- Saint George's Church (Mar Girgis)

Saint George's Church (Mar Girgis), otherwise called Blemish Girgis, is one of the most seasoned and memorable Coptic houses of worship that you will see in Egypt Classic tours. This old church is situated in the core of Old Cairo and traces back to the fourth hundred years. Holy person George's is known for its delightful stone carvings, shocking frescoes, and rich history, and it is one of the prominent Coptic chapels on the planet. You will discover many secrets about St George and his miracles in this fantastic place, so don't miss this great opportunity and book our Egypt religious tours.

3- Saint Mark's Coptic Orthodox Cathedral

Experience during Egypt Easter tours the Saint Mark's Coptic Orthodox Cathedral, the biggest Coptic church in Egypt, and the seat of the Coptic Conventional Pope. This cutting-edge church is situated in the core of Cairo and demonstrates the flexibility and strength of the Coptic Christian people group in Egypt. The house of God is known for its lovely design, dazzling stained glass windows, and rich history, and it is a must-visit for anyone interested in the Coptic Christian legacy in his Egypt Cultural tours.

4- The Church of Saint Geogra (El-khodariya)

The Church of Saint George, otherwise called El-Khodariya, is a delightful and memorable Coptic church situated in the core of Old Cairo. This old church is known for its shocking frescoes, lovely wood carvings, and rich history. What do you think about taking a felucca ride in Cairo after you finish your journey?

5- The Church of Saint Mena (El-Mena)

The Church of Saint Mena, or El-Mina, is a beautiful and noteworthy Coptic church in the desert beyond Alexandria. This remote and serene church is known for its incredible frescoes, beautiful carvings, and rich history.

I advise you to Head to discover our Alexandria day tours and be entertained by many enjoyable sites, such as the Alexandria library.
